sentences.english: All the farmers hate the wicked landlord.
sentences.chinese: 所有的农民都憎恨这个缺德的地主。

sentences.english: Her detestation and disgust must have found voice.
sentences.chinese: 她一定会发泄她的厌恶和憎恨的。

sentences.english: Any action is bound to merely increase antipathy against the 'Satanic west'.
sentences.chinese: 任何行动都注定只能增加对所谓‘邪恶西方’的憎恨。

sentences.english: He was also--He's also disliked, often hated, because of his views.
sentences.chinese: 他还因其观点而遭到唾弃，受到憎恨。

sentences.english: Let the perpetrator free from of your enmity and ultimately you will be on top.
sentences.chinese: 不要憎恨作恶者，最终你将会高屋建瓴。

sentences.english: He glowers at us with hate.
Ultimately, this reflects the resentments of a poor neighbor against a richer one.
sentences.chinese: 从根本上讲，这反映出穷国对于邻近富国的憎恨。

sentences.english: He hates the enemy and daubs himself with murderoous intent.
sentences.chinese: 他憎恨敌人，并以杀意涂满全身。？

sentences.english: Residents resented the police for abandoning them.
sentences.chinese: 当地的居民因警方对他们放任不管而心生憎恨。

sentences.english: Julia and her friends had a fascinated abhorrence of what they called "pont street" .
sentences.chinese: 朱莉娅和她的朋友们非常憎恨所谓的“庞特街”。

sentences.english: Whatever it is it's an abomination to the emperor.
sentences.chinese: 无论它是什么，那都是帝皇所憎恨的。

sentences.english: There was in him a headstrong little man who hated Napoleon.
sentences.chinese: 在他心里早就有个憎恨拿破仑的顽固小人儿了。
她说，每个人都憎恨技术。

sentences.english: Flattery brings friends, but the truth begets enmity.
sentences.chinese: 阿谀奉承也许能交到朋友，但真相会引起憎恨。

definition: to loathe/to hate/to abhor/see also 憎惡|憎恶[zeng1 e4]
to hate evil/see also 憎惡|憎恶[zeng1 wu4]
to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
to hate out of jealousy/to resent
to hate sb to the bone (idiom)
to be jealous of (sb's achievements etc)/to be envious/envy
